thread.title: Akhilesh Yadav, Ram Naik mourn death of Ravindra Jain
thread.title_full: Akhilesh Yadav, Ram Naik mourn death of Ravindra Jain - The Times of India

author: timesofindia.indiatimes.com
title: Akhilesh Yadav, Ram Naik mourn death of Ravindra Jain
text:
Uttar Pradesh Governor Ram Naik and Chief Minister Akhilesh Yadav condoled the death of legendary music composer, director, lyricist and singer Ravindra Jain, who died at Lilawati hospital in Mumbai on Friday.
READ: Multi-tasking musician Ravindra Jain passes away
In a condolence message, Naik recalled the contribution of Jain to the music world and said he had carved a niche for himself by his hard work and talent. He also recalled Jain's contribution in former prime minister Atal Bihari Vajpayee's live recording of 'Qadam Milakar Chalna Hoga: Svarna Jayanti Sangeet Sandhya' and termed his demise as an irreparable loss to the music world.
For latest Music updates, follow us on Twitter >>> @TOIEntertain
For the latest in Music news, like us on Facebook >>> TOIEntertain
Akhilesh Yadav too recalled Jain's contribution to music and said that it was his immense talent that led to his being awarded the Yash Bharti award by the state government. Praying for peace to the departed soul, he also extended his heartfelt condolences to the bereaved family in this hour of tragedy.
For more interesting Music news and pictures, follow us on Pinterest>>> timesofindia
For latest Music updates, follow us on G+ >>> The Times of India Entertainment
Ravindra Jain hailed from Aligarh district in Uttar Pradesh and enjoyed a huge following in the state. He was a regular visitor to the state.
Listen to Ravindra Jain songs on Gaana.com
